net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.complex

Class AbstractUiWidgetTableColumn<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterTableColumn,ROW,CELL>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.feature.AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>
      • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.AbstractUiWidget<VALUE>
        • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.AbstractUiWidgetNative<ADAPTER,CELL>
          • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.complex.AbstractUiWidgetTableColumn<ADAPTER,ROW,CELL>
  • Type Parameters:
    ADAPTER - is the generic type of AbstractUiWidgetNative.getWidgetAdapter().
    ROW - is the generic type of the element representing a row of the grid. It should be a java-bean oriented object. Immutable objects (that have no setters) can also be used but only for read-only tables.
    CELL - is the generic type of the values located in the cells of this column.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadAriaRole, AttributeReadEditable, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadMode, AttributeReadModeFixed, AttributeReadModified, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadReorderable, AttributeReadResizable, AttributeReadSortable, AttributeReadSortComparator<CELL>, AttributeReadStringTitle, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadValueAdvanced<CELL>, AttributeReadVisible, AttributeReadVisibleRecursive, AttributeWriteAriaRole, AttributeWriteEditable, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteMode, AttributeWriteModeFixed, AttributeWriteModified, AttributeWriteOnlyFocused, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteReorderable, AttributeWriteResizable, AttributeWriteSortable, AttributeWriteSortComparator<CELL>, AttributeWriteStringTitle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteValueAdvanced<CELL>, AttributeWriteVisible, AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced, UiFeature, UiFeatureEvent, UiFeatureMessages, UiFeatureMode, UiFeatureValidation<CELL>, UiFeatureValue<CELL>, UiFeatureValueAndValidation<CELL>, UiWidgetTableColumn<ROW,CELL>, UiWidget, UiWidgetAbstractComposite, UiWidgetAbstractWithValue<CELL>, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadTitle<String>, AttributeReadValue<CELL>, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteTitle<String>, AttributeWriteValue<CELL>, Accessibility, AbstractValidatableObject, HasValueValidators<CELL>, ValidatableObject<CELL>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UiWidgetTableColumnImpl

    public abstract class AbstractUiWidgetTableColumn<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterTableColumn,ROW,CELL>
extends AbstractUiWidgetNative<ADAPTER,CELL>
implements UiWidgetTableColumn<ROW,CELL>
    This is the abstract base implementation of UiWidgetTableColumn.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

        listTable - is the list table this column is connected to.
        typedProperty - is the typed property of the column to create. May be null.
        widgetAdapter - is the widget adapter. Typically null for lazy initialization.

      • getTypedProperty

        public TypedProperty<CELL> getTypedProperty()
        Returns:
        the TypedProperty identifying the property managed with this column. May be null if the column was created with an explicit property accessor. In such case the widget factory shall not be null or cells with null values can not be handled.

      • isEditable

        public boolean isEditable()
        This method gets the editable status of this object. Editable means that the end-user can edit the data of the object if also in edit mode (e.g. a data table that allows inline editing). If the editable feature is turned off, the user can no longer edit the data.
        This is closely related to AttributeReadEnabled.isEnabled(). However turning off the editable-flag is weaker than disabling a UI object. An enabled but NOT editable object may still allow user-interaction (e.g. a combobox that still allows selection out of a predefined list but no editing of the text). Further the visualization is softer (no grey out of the entire object).
        ATTENTION:
        There may be other aspects that have influence if the user can currently edit this object such as the mode or enabled flag. This method only returns the editable flag (as set via AttributeWriteEditable.setEditable(boolean)) and therefore only tells if the object is potentially editable.
        Specified by:
        isEditable in interface AttributeReadEditable
        Returns:
        true if this object is editable, false otherwise.

      • setEditable

        public void setEditable(boolean editableFlag)
        This method set the editable status.
        Specified by:
        setEditable in interface AttributeWriteEditable
        Parameters:
        editableFlag - if true the object will become editable, if false the object will become un-editable.

      • setSortComparator

        public void setSortComparator(Comparator<CELL> sortComparator)
        This method sets the sort-comparator attribute. If <VALUE> implements Comparable you may simple provide ComparableComparator.getInstance() as argument (unless a more specific sorting is required here).
        Specified by:
        setSortComparator in interface AttributeWriteSortComparator<CELL>
        Parameters:
        sortComparator - is the new value of AttributeReadSortComparator.getSortComparator(). May be null to disable sorting.

      • getSortComparator

        public Comparator<CELL> getSortComparator()

        Specified by:
        getSortComparator in interface AttributeReadSortComparator<CELL>
        Returns:
        the Comparator used to sort the values. May be null if NOT set what will prevent sorting.

        public boolean isSortable()

        Specified by:
        isSortable in interface UiWidgetTableColumn<ROW,CELL>
        Returns:

      • getCurrentIndex

        public int getCurrentIndex()
        Returns:
        the current index of this column according to the actual order of the columns. This may change due to reordering or internal technical columns (e.g. row-numbers or checkboxes for multi-selection).
